tweets.text:
We often urge you not to drive through floodwater - 30mm/12ins can move a car...

The same goes for taking care on riverbanks and paths... 

Please avoid walking, running and cycling through standing water close to rivers...

Pix: Pangbourne, Berkshire, 2019
#floodaware https://t.co/ao98uvK0Dk

Plz email: info@sevatrustuk.org 
or text/call 07417478274

@BedfordTweets @bedspolice @BedsFire @DaveTheMayor @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @BBC3CR

We have been advised by @EnvAgency that the peak of the high water moving down the Great Ouse has now passed through Bedford and Kempston. Working with partners, we're out monitoring the peak as it moves east and responding to requests for assistance. https://t.co/eFodUk2u2s

#BoxingDay boots on the ground...

Our staff are checking the #RiverThames at various points, to protect communities...

...like here at #Cookham in #Berkshire...

YOU can check you or your family‚Äôs flood-risk: https://t.co/9VF8a4JFXi #floodaware https://t.co/mYQ3H63UjI

Really not the #BoxingDay scene you‚Äôd want to see. Many @EnvAgency #flood warnings in force inc 3 severe (risk to life). Pls do follow advice from @bedspolice @BedsFire local councils. #PrepareActSurvive #FloodAware https://t.co/tOekpYnuQg

We are expecting heavy rainfall in the Yorkshire area this evening and into tomorrow morning. Please check your local flood risk and be prepared to take action if you are at risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #floodaware

Thank you @EnvAgency @SuffolkFire @Norfolkfire @SuffolkPolice @NorfolkPolice volunteers and other agencies for the fantastic help and support last night and today. We are counting our blessings. Merry Christmas üéÑ#flooding https://t.co/Jvlr27e3QF

tweets.text: @BMS_BoatClub @EnvAgency @BedfordTweets Yep. Wriggled out of its chains at one end and storm Bella to come later today. Fingers crossed but too dangerous to fix. If you see it passing your place can you call us?
@StarClubRowing @EnvAgency @BedfordTweets Is the landing stage trying to escape?!

Luckily we stayed above the high water mark - but actually not luck, of course. Thanks to @EnvAgency and @BedfordTweets for keeping us up to date with levels and flood info so we knew what was coming - sorry if you missed your Christmas Day but a sincere thank you... https://t.co/JXbC61OREA

tweets.text: Looking serious with more rain forecast. Time for @DefraGovUK  @EnvAgency to start proactive investing in more flood prevention and perhaps a return to paying farmers for making land available for flood aleveatation + support for more winter fill reservoir construction ? https://t.co/1xBlcphIPU

üöóDriving through flood water is the number one cause of death during flooding

üöó30cm of moving water can float your car 

üöóJust one egg cupful of water can wreck your engine

Our team is out in #SouthHinksey #Oxford erecting a temporary flood barrier¬†to protect properties from flooding. River levels have risen¬†fast following heavy rainfall. Further rainfall is expected¬†on Saturday and Sunday with #Storm Bella.¬†Please stay #FloodAware.¬†1/2

6inch pump drawing the water away from the road in #South Hinksey #Oxford ,keeping the residents protected ,great work by the field teams #TeamEA .@MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea https://t.co/1EXDExzvYk
